reviews.text: My wife and two-year-old daughter stayed at this hotel on a four-day trip to Munich in May 2011 and I must admit, having read reviews here I was a little nervous. But we needn't have worried. We arrived late to the hotel but they had waited for us to arrive (even though we had been given the code for the key lock. We had a corner room facing out on to the street and the church that so many other reviewers have made mention of. We went down to the restaurant on the first night and even though the kitchen was closed they knocked up a nice salad, creamed cheese and pretzels for us to accompany the lovely wheat beer. Next morning we discovered that there's a decent coffee machine in the foyer along with pastries, cake and fruit - all for free and certainly enough to get us started each day. The room itself was a bit warm and there is some noise from the road out front but I'm a light sleeper and I wasn't troubled by it. We heard the infamous church bells once on a Sunday morning and only briefly. We had a proper sit-down dinner at the restaurant on the third night and it was good-value Bavarian fare and not nearly as pricey as some of the places in the city centre. It is a little out of the city centre but nearby transport is ample. The 52 bus runs straight into the centre from out front of the hotel and Fraunhoferstraube U-bahn station is a quick walk across the river. It's very closeby the Deutsches Museum and the wonderful Wirthaus In Der Au Bavarian restaurant is just round the corner. As mentioned it's very closeby the river and it's a wonderful walk. We'd happily return here and recommend it to anyone visiting Munich.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel at a reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights, clean rooms, good breakfast. Unfortunately our room was not a non-smoker room, so it was a bit smelly. First 3 nights were reasonably priced but had to extend on night..and that night cost us 160 Euro as there was apparently a conference in the city (but the hotel was still empty).
reviews.title: Clean rooms, bit expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly and helpful front desk staff.
reviews.title: For whom the bell tolls, it tolls ..... a lot

reviews.text: This unassuming hotel is just across the river from the city centre, in a pleasant residential area with good tube or bus connections into the city. It also has the significant advantage of being close to a brilliant cafe/deli 'The Hungry Heart', and not far from a cash point. The only other amenities of note closeby are the science museum and the church in Mariahilfplatz, this latter having some particularly carrying chimes.
reviews.title: Not amused at all

reviews.text: This is a shame, because combined with, albeit low-level, traffic noise seemingly thoughout the night, it didn't contribute to the best nights' sleep I've ever had in my life. This was particularly frustrating because the room and the beds were comfortable with a clean modern bathroom. Other irritations were poor lighting for reading and unlined curtains which allowed a significant amount of unwanted light to seep into the room room at night. I'd suggest asking for a room at the back of the hotel away from the road which would solve the noise and excessive external light problem. As for reading: you'll just have to take a headlight with you! Or watch the television.
reviews.title: A good find on the edge of the old city.

reviews.text: It was not an easy location for seeing the sights of Munich. The street was horribly noisy, but if we closed the windows we baked. The internet was 13 euros a day. The restaurant was pleasant and had a nice garden.
reviews.title: Not a good choice

reviews.text: We were very pleasantly surprised by the rooms and by the restaurant/pub downstairs. The rooms were clean and the service was OK although we had reserved non-smoking rooms and we got smoking ones. The hotel has a good position from the city center and is relatively close to the tube stations. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great conditions at a resonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food from the restaurant was great although the prices are comparable to ones in the center.
reviews.title: Good location, cozy room, low price.

reviews.text: The reception staff was friendly and gave us a lot of useful information. The room was not very big, but very clean and nice furnished. The double bed was big. The room was very warm even though it was very cold outside.
reviews.title: Good, no-frills, friendly hotel. You get what you pay for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is close to the city center and extremely close to a bus station. You have to walk for about 10 min to get to a subway station.
reviews.title: Decent hotel for the money
really enjoyable stay
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Altmunchen for 3 nights in January 2005. We were a bit concerned after having read an adverse review on trip advisor. However, we really enjoyed our stay. While it's true that it's not close by a subway station, there's a bus stop 50 metres from the hotel and buses leave for the city centre every 6 minutes or so. Travel time to the city centre is 5 - 10 mins. The room was fairly small (we found that to be the case throughout our travels in Europe) but the bedroom and bathroom were clean and well appointed. Would recommend that you ask for a room not facing the main street as I imagine those rooms could get noisy. Our room faced the courtyard and we had no problem with traffic noise. There is a restaurant downstairs, we dined there one evening and really enjoyed the food. Noise from the restaurant was never a problem even though we were there over the weekend. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Room rate was 68 Euro and we thought that was good value. Breakfast was nice, but at 22 Euro for 2 people seemed quite expensive when seen against the room rate. Watch out for the cost of bottled water from the minibar - $A7 for 500ml. Overall not sure how the Altmunchen compares with other Munich hotels but we would definitely use it again.

reviews.title: do yourself a fover and pick another place
Great little place
reviews.text: The hotel does not have air conditioning, and is located on a very busy and noisy street, which does not really stop through the night, making getting a restful night of sleep difficult. The room themselves are well appointed. The TV only shows CNN in English, all the other channels are German exclusively.
Stayed a couple of days in this hotel. Attic room was very nice and well equipped - the lighting could be improved however.
reviews.title: nice location
At this price you can do better
reviews.text: Reception staff was friendly. House keeping was rather unattentive however. Cleanliness could be improved. Rooms facing the street get a little noisy in the morning.
Location is near "Deutsches Museum" and near to a bus stop but not to the underground. There are a couple of nice pubs and places to eat in the area.
reviews.title: Bit Out Of The Way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free parking is hard to find around. There's an hotel parking which you have to pay for.
reviews.title: Great little hotel!
Great Value, Great Stay
reviews.text: Overall value for money is ok.
